Package edu.monash.fit2099.engine

Interface Weapon

All Known Implementing Classes:
BroadSword, GreatMachete, IntrinsicWeapon, MeleeWeapon, Stick, StormRuler, Sword, WeaponItem
public interface Weapon
Interface for weapon items. As well as providing methods needed by weapons, this interface is used in Item to determine whether an item can be used as a weapon.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int chanceToHit()
    A chance to hit the target (this is a dividend part of percentage)
    int damage()
    The amount of damage the Weapon will inflict
    default WeaponAction getActiveSkill​(Actor target, java.lang.String direction)
    Get an action or skill from the weapon that will be used against one target.
    java.lang.String verb()
    A verb to use when displaying the results of attacking with this Weapon

  • Method Details

    • damage

      int damage()
      The amount of damage the Weapon will inflict
      Returns:
      the damage, in hitpoints

    • verb

      java.lang.String verb()
      A verb to use when displaying the results of attacking with this Weapon
      Returns:
      String, e.g. "punches", "zaps"

    • chanceToHit

      int chanceToHit()
      A chance to hit the target (this is a dividend part of percentage)
      Returns:
      the chance, in integer for probability with nextInt(), e.g 100 = 100% hit rate

    • getActiveSkill

      default WeaponAction getActiveSkill​(Actor target, java.lang.String direction)
      Get an action or skill from the weapon that will be used against one target. This method allows weapon instance to interact with Actor class. It can be used to have actionable special attack, heal, silence, etc. to a target
      Parameters:
      target - the target actor
      direction - the direction of target, e.g. "north"
      Returns:
      null by default because a weapon doesn't have any active skill. Otherwise, return a WeaponAction instance.
      See Also:
      for a self-direction skill instead of using this method (recommendation)
